Row.Text: All players are still in control of their original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals.
You are leading by controlling {1_num} original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals.
An unmet player controls {1_num} original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals.
An unmet civilization controls their original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
You control {1_CityName}, the original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital of {2_CivName}.
An unmet player controls {1_CityName}, the original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital of {2_CivName}.
{1_PlayerName} controls the original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital of an unmet civilization.
An unmet player controls the original [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital of another unmet civilization.
You have not built a Capital city.
{1_PlayerName} has not built a Capital city.
An unmet player has not built a Capital city.
You have {1_TradeRoutesUsedNum} trade units.[NEWLINE]You have {2_TradeRoutesAvailableNum} trade routes available.
Trade routes others established to your civilization
Allows establishing an additional trade route.
Extends the range of sea trade routes.
Extends the range of land trade routes.
{1_CivName} has discovered {2_Num} technologies that you do not know. You are receiving {3_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science on this route due to your Cultural Influence over them.
You have discovered {1_Num} technologies that {2_CivName} does not know. They are receiving {3_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science on this route due to their Cultural Influence over you.
Lists the trade routes you have established with other cities.
Lists all the trade routes that may be established, including those you have already established.
List of all the trade routes others have established with your cities.
Trade units may either be across land (with a caravan) or water (with a cargo ship).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Click to sort by the domain for the trade routes.
Click to sort by which civilization the trade route is coming from.
Click to sort by which city the trade route is coming from.
Click to sort by which civilization the trade route is going to.
Click to sort by which city the trade route is going to.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_GOLD] Gold that the civilization that established the trade route generates from this trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_GOLD] Gold that the destination civilization would receive from this trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_FOOD] Food that the destination city would receive from this trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production that the destination city would receive from this trade route.
Click to sort by the religious pressure that the origin city of the trade route would receive from the destination city.
Click to sort by the religious pressure that the destination city of the trade route would receive from the origin city.
Click to sort by the turns remaining on the trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_RESEARCH] Science that the civilization that established the trade route generates from this trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_RESEARCH] Science that the destination civilization would receive from this trade route.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot construct this trade unit because there are no available land trade routes.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot construct this trade unit because there are no available sea trade routes.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You cannot construct a trade unit because you are at your trade unit limit.
[COLOR_RED]No slots available for Great Works of Art![ENDCOLOR]
Artifact will be placed in nearest Great Work of Art slot. Artifact provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism. Archaeologist will be consumed.
Ancient writing will be placed in nearest Great Work of Writing slot. Writing provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism. Archaeologist will be consumed.
When worked, a Landmark provides [ICON_CULTURE] Culture based on its age. +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture per Era older than this civ's current Era. Archaeologist will be consumed.
[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Creating a Landmark in another civ's territory will give you a permanent diplomatic boost with that nation.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Creating a Landmark in a city state's territory will give you a large, one-time influence boost with that city state.[ENDCOLOR]
The written artifact will be consumed to give the civilization a large one-time [ICON_CULTURE] Culture boost.
Number of Civilizations for which Influential culture has been achieved out of the total number required for Culture Victory

Possible values are:[NEWLINE]- Unknown[NEWLINE]- Exotic[NEWLINE]- Familiar[NEWLINE]- Popular[NEWLINE]- Influential[NEWLINE]- Dominant[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Accrue benefits against the influenced civ starting at the Familiar influence level:[NEWLINE] 1. Bonus [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Trade Routes[NEWLINE] 2. [ICON_SPY] Spies are more effective[NEWLINE] 3. Easier to control conquered Cities

[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Accrued benefits:[NEWLINE]- Each Trade Route to influenced civ:[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science[NEWLINE]- [ICON_SPY] Spies Establish Surveillance in 1 turn[NEWLINE]- When conquering influenced civ's city:[NEWLINE]25% reduction in Unrest time/Population loss

[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Accrued benefits:[NEWLINE]- Each Trade Route to influenced civ:[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science[NEWLINE]- [ICON_SPY] Spies Establish Surveillance in 1 turn and operate at 1 Rank higher in influenced civ's city state allies[NEWLINE]- When conquering influenced civ's city:[NEWLINE]50% reduction in Unrest time/Population loss

[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Accrued benefits:[NEWLINE]- Each Trade Route to influenced civ:[NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science[NEWLINE]- [ICON_SPY] Spies Establish Surveillance in 1 turn and operate at 1 Rank higher in influenced civ's cities and city state allies[NEWLINE]- When conquering influenced civ's city:[NEWLINE]75% reduction in Unrest time/Population loss

Accrued benefits:[NEWLINE]- Each Trade Route to influenced civ:[NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science[NEWLINE]- [ICON_SPY] Spies Establish Surveillance in 1 turn and operate at 2 Ranks higher in influenced civ's cities and city state allies[NEWLINE]- When conquering influenced civ's city:[NEWLINE]no Unrest time and no Population loss

[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spy is operating {1_SpyBonus} {1_SpyBonus: plural 1?Rank; other?Ranks;} higher than normal since this city state is allied to a civ over which you have strong cultural influence.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spy is operating {1_SpyBonus} {1_SpyBonus: plural 1?Rank; other?Ranks;} higher than normal since you have strong cultural influence over this civ.[ENDCOLOR]
Lifetime [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism as a percentage of target civ's lifetime [ICON_CULTURE] Culture
Modifiers to Tourism [ICON_TOURISM] output to target civ
Rising or Falling Indicator[NEWLINE](and if Rising, tooltip shows number of turns until Influential)
Influential in {1_Num} Turns (assuming Tourism output remains unchanged)
{1_Num} [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from Museum and Wonder Theming Bonuses
{1_Num} [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from {2_Num}% of the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from World Wonders, Natural Wonders, and Improvements
{1_Num} [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from buildings constructed by [ICON_PEACE] Faith
+{1_Num}% Bonus from being the Holy City of the World Religion
+{1_Num}% Bonus for being at war with a common foe:[NEWLINE]
+{1_Num}% Bonus for Trade Route between civs[NEWLINE]
+{1_Num}% Bonus for being at war with a common foe[NEWLINE]
+{1_Num}% Bonus for propaganda from a Diplomat[NEWLINE]

Civilization's satisfaction with their current Ideology choice.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Possible values are:[NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]- Content[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]- Dissidents[NEWLINE][COLOR_YELLOW]- Civil Resistance[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]- Revolutionary Wave[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Some level of [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness will be generated if this satisfaction level is anything other than [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Content[ENDCOLOR].

The Public Opinion of each civ is tracked once that empire adopts an Ideology and is calculated based on the outgoing Influence of a civ compared with the incoming Influence from other civs with an Ideology.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If the Influence pressure for other Ideologies exceeds the pressure for the current Ideology, Public Opinion will drift away from [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Content[ENDCOLOR] and create [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness. The summary below shows a symbol for each unit of pressure towards an Ideology.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
Not influenced by the Ideology of any other civ.
Influenced by the World Ideology as chosen by the World Congress:
Influenced by the Ideology of these civs:
Current [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness due to Public Opinion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Consider this to be how much the people of this civ approve of their leader's choice of Ideology.

Current overall [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness level[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unhappiness from Public Opinion is included in this total. At -20 or below the civilization will start to lose cities to revolt and may change to the public's Preferred Ideology (you can find that preference in the Public Opinion tooltip).
{1_Civ} is {2_Num: number #.#}% influential over an unmet civilization.
Left click on great works to move them from location to another.
Left click on great works to view them.
The People We All Like to Visit
Ranks players by the number of Civs over whom their [ICON_CULTURE] Culture has become Influential.
The Cities We All Like to Visit
Are you sure you wish to adopt [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_PolicyName}[ENDCOLOR]?
Enables founding of the World Congress, once every other Civilization has been met.

Gain {1_DelegatesPerDiplomat} additional {1_DelegatesPerDiplomat: plural 1?Delegate; other?Delegates;} in the World Congress for every Spy as a [ICON_DIPLOMAT] Diplomat in another Civilization's [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
[ICON_GREAT_WORK] Great Work of Art or Artifact slots: {1_NumSlots}
Influential on {1_XofYString} Civilizations needed for Culture Victory

Click to change what you are willing to swap for a Great Work of Writing. Great Works of Writing may only be swapped for another Great Work of Writing. Once an item is swapped with another civilization for another item, the item you received will go into the building or wonder slot your original item occupied. Your new item may not be traded again this turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you select a Great Work of Writing for a slot but do not perform a swap on your turn, other civilizations may swap for it on their turn without your permission! Make sure you only display items that you are willing to part with!

Click to change what you are willing to swap for a Great Work of Art. Great Works of Art may only be swapped for another Great Work of Art. Once an item is swapped with another civilization for another item, the item you received will go into the building or wonder slot your original item occupied. Your new item may not be traded again this turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you select a Great Work of Art for a slot but do not perform a swap on your turn, other civilizations may swap for it on their turn without your permission! Make sure you only display items that you are willing to part with!

Click to change what you are willing to swap for an Artifact. Artifacts may only be swapped for another Artifact. Once an item is swapped with another civilization for another item, the item you received will go into the building or wonder slot your original item occupied. Your new item may not be traded again this turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you select an Artifact for a slot but do not perform a swap on your turn, other civilizations may swap for it on their turn without your permission! Make sure you only display items that you are willing to part with!

Click to change what you are willing to swap for a Great Work of Music. Great Works of Music may only be swapped for another Great Work of Music. Once an item is swapped with another civilization for another item, the item you received will go into the building or wonder slot your original item occupied. Your new item may not be traded again this turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you select a Great Work of Music for a slot but do not perform a swap on your turn, other civilizations may swap for it on their turn without your permission! Make sure you only display Great Works or Artifacts that you are willing to part with!
{1_CivShortDesc} {1_CivShortDesc: plural 1?has; other?have;} not displayed a Great Work of Writing that can be swapped.
{1_CivShortDesc} {1_CivShortDesc: plural 1?has; other?have;} not displayed Great Work of Art that can be swapped.
{1_CivShortDesc} {1_CivShortDesc: plural 1?has; other?have;} not displayed an Artifact that can be swapped.
{1_CivShortDesc} {1_CivShortDesc: plural 1?has; other?have;} not displayed Great Work of Music that can be swapped.
{1_CivShortDesc} {1_CivShortDesc: plural 1?is; other?are;} willing to swap this Great Work of Writing for another Great Work of Writing.
{1_CivShortDesc} {1_CivShortDesc: plural 1?is; other?are;} willing to swap this Great Work of Art for another Great Work of Art.
{1_CivShortDesc} {1_CivShortDesc: plural 1?is; other?are;} willing to swap this Artifact for another Artifact.
{1_CivShortDesc} {1_CivShortDesc: plural 1?is; other?are;} willing to swap this Great Work of Music for another Great Work of Music.

This will exchange your Great Work or Artifact for another civilization's Great Work or Artifact. Your item will go into one of their cities and their item will go into the slot that held the item you traded. An item may only be swapped once a turn.

To swap a Great Work or Artifact, you need to select one of your items and select another civilization's item of the same type. (Great Work of Writing can only be swapped for another Great Work of Writing.)
This will reset the proposed Great Work exchange.
This will clear this slot so that you may not swap it for anything else on your turn. Also, other Civs will not be able to swap for any of this type of item on their turn if the slot is empty.
You may swap Great Works or Artifacts with any Civilization that you are not at war with.
Choose Ancient Ruin Bonus from List
Diplomacy[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Turns until the World Congress convenes: {1_Num}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As players advance to later eras, this interval becomes shorter.

Diplomacy[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Turns until the United Nations convenes: {1_TurnsUntilSession}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Turns until the next [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]World Leader[ENDCOLOR] proposal: {2_TurnsUntilVictorySession}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Diplomatic Victory[ENDCOLOR] is now possible. To win, a Civilization must receive the support of enough delegates in a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]World Leader[ENDCOLOR] proposal.
You are {1_Num: number #.#}% influential over an unmet civilization.
Turns until next World Leader proposal:
Delegates to win World Leader proposal:
The United Nations is active, and Victory is possible.
The United Nations has not yet begun.

Time and again throughout history, there have arisen men and women who have profoundly changed the world around them - artists, scientists, generals, merchants and others, whose genius sets them head and shoulders above the rest. In this game such visionaries are called "Great People."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There are nine different kinds of great people in the game: Great Merchants, Great Artists, Great Musicians, Great Writers, Great Scientists, Great Engineers, Great Generals, Great Admirals, and Great Prophets. Each has a special ability.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your civilization acquires Great People by constructing certain buildings and wonders, and then staffing them with "specialists", citizens from your cities who have given up working in the field or the mines. While specialists do not work city tiles, they do greatly speed the arrival of Great People. Balancing the need for production and food and the desire for Great People is an important challenge of city management.
Are you sure you want to declare war on {1_CivName}?

{1_SpyRank} {2_SpyName} is in {3_CityName} as a diplomat. While {4_SpyRank} {5_SpyName} is in the city, they establish surveillance and inform you on that Civ's World Congress voting. {6_SpyRank} {7_SpyName} will also inform you of any intrigue that they discover during their visit.
